ObjectStates.Name: Deck
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
--[[ DECK ]]--

--[[
In this file we store:

- initCardTable: Function that constructs CardTable, a data structure mapping card names to values.

]]--

function initCardTable(CardTable)

  suits = {'Diamonds', 'Clubs', 'Hearts', 'Spades'}
  nums = {2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9,10}
  faces = {'Jack', 'Queen', 'King'}

  for suit in pairs(suits) do
    -- Do the suit's Ace first.
    -- We will count it as 11 here, then implement the functionality to count it as a 1 in the bustChecker function!
    str = 'Ace of ' .. suits[suit]
    CardTable[str] = 11

    -- Add number cards
    for num in pairs(nums) do
      str = tostring(nums[num]) .. ' of ' .. suits[suit]
      CardTable[str] = nums[num]
    end

    -- Add face cards
    for face in pairs(faces) do
      str = faces[face] .. ' of ' .. suits[suit]
      CardTable[str] = 10
    end

  end
  return CardTable
end

function initGameState(GameState)
  -- Returns a table with GameState values. Included are:
  -- Player's Current State. Defaults to 0, which is Not Dealt In.
  -- 1 = Dealt In
  -- 2 = Busted
  -- 3 = Beat Dealer
  player_states = {}
  player_states['White'] = 0
  player_states['Purple'] = 0
  player_states['Green'] = 0
  player_states['Red'] = 0
  -- Dealer Hand Value. Int.
  dealer_hand = {}
  -- Players Done (either Stood or Busted). List of Bools, 1 Done, 0 if Not.
  players_done = {}
  return GameState
end

LuaScript:
--[[ Lua code. See documentation: https://api.tabletopsimulator.com/ --]]

--[[
The Global file will serve as our main function.
However, lots of our implementation will be stored in scripting files
attached to objects.
Documentation as to what can be found where, by file:

GLOBAL:
Global.-1.ttslua:
- OnLoad

DECK:
Deck.38e0da.ttslua:
- initCardTable: Function that constructs CardTable.
CardTable is a data structure that maps card names to numeric values.
Will be used for implementing game logic.

]]--

--TODO: Implement full version of game where Aces can take on multiple values!

--[[ The onLoad event is called after the game save finishes loading. --]]


-- GUI PARAMETERS FOR THE THREE TYPES OF BUTTONS: --

deal_parameters = {}
deal_parameters.click_function = 'deal_me'
deal_parameters.function_owner = self
deal_parameters.label = 'DEAL ME IN!'
deal_parameters.position = {0,0.2,0}
deal_parameters.rotation = {0,0,0}
deal_parameters.width = 1800
deal_parameters.height = 1000
deal_parameters.font_size = 300

stand_parameters = {}
stand_parameters.click_function = 'stand'
stand_parameters.function_owner = self
stand_parameters.label = 'STAND'
stand_parameters.position = {0,0.2,0}
stand_parameters.rotation = {0,0,0}
stand_parameters.width = 1000
stand_parameters.height = 1000
stand_parameters.font_size = 300

hit_parameters = {}
hit_parameters.click_function = 'hit'
hit_parameters.function_owner = self
hit_parameters.label = 'HIT'
hit_parameters.position = {0,0.2,0}
hit_parameters.rotation = {0,0,0}
hit_parameters.width = 1000
hit_parameters.height = 1000
hit_parameters.font_size = 300


function onLoad()

  -- Construct the CardTableand GameState data structures for implementing game logic
  deck = getObjectFromGUID('38e0da')
  CardTable = {}
  CardTable = deck.call('initCardTable', CardTable)
  GameState = {}
  GameState = deck.call('initGameState', GameState)

  -- Create deal buttons for each player at table
  josh_deal = getObjectFromGUID('60314e')
  josh_deal.createButton(deal_parameters)

  nick_deal = getObjectFromGUID('03ef20')
  nick_deal.createButton(deal_parameters)

  ash_deal = getObjectFromGUID('35de35')
  ash_deal.createButton(deal_parameters)

  bella_deal = getObjectFromGUID('785620')
  bella_deal.createButton(deal_parameters)

  deck.shuffle()
  GameState['dealer_hand'] = dealer_draw()

  printToAll('Players Seated:')
  for i, player in ipairs(Player.getPlayers()) do
    printToAll(player.color)
  end

end


--- SETUP AND BUTTON FUNCTIONS ---


function dealer_draw()
  -- Draws two cards to the Red hand, which is the Dealer's
  -- Returns the value of the Dealer's hand

  card1 = deal_card('Red')
  card2 = deal_card('Red')
  sum = sum_hand('Red', {card1, card2})
  printToAll('Beginning game! \n The number to beat is: ' .. sum)
  if sum < 11 then
    printToAll("The dealer isn't happy with his hand. He'll hit again to keep things interesting ;)")
    card3 = deal_card('Red')
    sum = sum_hand('Red', {card1, card2, card3})
    printToAll("Ah, that's better. \n The number to beat is: " .. sum)
  end
  return sum
end


function deal_me(objectButtonClicked, playerColorClicked)
  -- when clicked, it'll deal the player who pressed the button 2 cards
  printToAll(playerColorClicked.." has been dealt in!")
  card1 = deal_card(playerColorClicked)
  card2 = deal_card(playerColorClicked)
  printToAll('Current hand value for '..playerColorClicked..': '..sum_hand(playerColorClicked, {card1,card2}))
  win_checker(playerColorClicked, {card1,card2})

  -- Create Hit and Stand buttons
  if playerColorClicked == 'White' then
    josh_hit = getObjectFromGUID('6f947d')
    josh_hit.createButton(hit_parameters)
    josh_stand = getObjectFromGUID('6f417a')
    josh_stand.createButton(stand_parameters)
  end

  if playerColorClicked == 'Purple' then
    nick_hit = getObjectFromGUID('51a3c3')
    nick_hit.createButton(hit_parameters)
    nick_stand = getObjectFromGUID('d94ee7')
    nick_stand.createButton(stand_parameters)
  end

  if playerColorClicked == 'Green' then
    ash_hit = getObjectFromGUID('0cc6a2')
    ash_hit.createButton(hit_parameters)
    ash_stand = getObjectFromGUID('89c07d')
    ash_stand.createButton(stand_parameters)
  end

  if playerColorClicked == 'Orange' then
    bella_hit = getObjectFromGUID('a37116')
    bella_hit.createButton(hit_parameters)
    bella_stand = getObjectFromGUID('25f0c0')
    bella_stand.createButton(stand_parameters)
  end

end


function hit(objectButtonClicked, playerColorClicked)
  -- when clicked, player will be dealt 1 card
  caller_color = playerColorClicked
  printToAll(caller_color.." has been dealt in!")
  card = deal_card(caller_color)
  bust_checker(caller_color, {card})
  win_checker(caller_color, {card})


  -- might be a good place to get value of said dealt card and add to
  -- the player's counter. if counter > 21, then it's a bust :o
end


function stand(objectButtonClicked, playerColorClicked)
  -- when clicked, the game stops
  caller_color = playerColorClicked
  printToAll(playerColorClicked.." player stands!")
  printToAll('Current hand value for '..playerColorClicked..': '..sum_hand(playerColorClicked, {}))
  -- this is probably where we compare the counters of dealer and player
  -- to decide who wins uwu
end


--- HELPER FUNCTIONS ---

function sum_hand(player_color, new_cards)
  -- Helper function for game logic that sums the contents of a player's hand
  -- new_cards is a table of any new cards drawn. Defaults to empty table.
  -- new_cards should be passed from any button-mapped functions that adds cards to a hand
  new_cards = new_cards or {}

  hand = Player[player_color].getHandObjects()
  sum = 0
  -- add existing cards in hand
  for i, card in ipairs(hand) do
    sum = sum + CardTable[card.getName()]
  end
  -- add new cards being drawn
  for i, card in ipairs(new_cards) do
    sum = sum + CardTable[card.getName()]
  end
  return sum
end


function deal_card(player_color)
  -- helper function for Deal, Hit, and Stand functions
  -- Set hand parameters for takeObject
  -- Returns card that was dealt for use by sum_hand function elsewhere
  if player_color == 'White' then
    hand_pos = {x = 0, y = 5, z = -15}
    hand_rotation = {0, 0, 0}
  end

  if player_color == 'Purple' then
    hand_pos = {x = 15, y = 5, z = 0}
    hand_rotation = {0, 90, 0}
  end

  if player_color == 'Green' then
    hand_pos = {x = 0, y = 5, z = 15}
    hand_rotation = {0, 0, 0}
  end

  if player_color == 'Orange' then
    hand_pos = {x = -15, y = 5, z = 0}
      hand_rotation = {0, 90, 0}
  end

  if player_color == 'Red' then
    hand_pos = {x = 0, y = 5, z = -3}
    hand_rotation = {0,0,0}
  end
  -- Add object to hand zone and then sum hand for game logic!
  card = deck.takeObject({position = hand_pos, rotation = hand_rotation, smooth = false, flip = true})
  return card
end


--- GAME LOGIC FUNCTIONS ---

function bust_checker(player_color, new_cards)
  -- Looks at current hand + new cards drawn to determine if hand is a bust.
  -- This is ALSO the function responsible for printing information about the game state!
  -- If sum of all cards in hand > 21, the hand is a bust and you lose!
  -- However, Aces can take on two values: 21 and 1 - whichever is better for you!
  -- TODO: Implement Aces taking on multiple values!!!

  sum = sum_hand(player_color, new_cards)
  printToAll('Current hand value for '..caller_color..': '.. sum)

  -- If sum is greater than 21, knock that player OUT OF THE GAME
  if sum > 21 then
    printToAll(sum .. " is a bust! " .. "Sorry, " .. player_color .. ", you're out!")
    player_done(player_color)

  end
end


function win_checker(player_color, new_cards)
  -- Checks player's hand value against the Dealer's to see if they've won!
  sum = sum_hand(player_color, new_cards)

  if sum >= GameState['dealer_hand'] then
    printToAll("Congratulations, "..player_color.." -  you beat the dealer!")
    player_done(player_color)

    if sum == 21 then
      printToAll("21 - BLACKJACK!")
    end
  end
end


function player_done(player_color)
  -- Cleans up a players buttons when they Stand, Win, or Bust
  if player_color == 'White' then
    josh_deal.destruct()
    josh_hit.destruct()
    josh_stand.destruct()
  end

  if player_color == 'Purple' then
    nick_deal.destruct()
    nick_hit.destruct()
    nick_stand.destruct()
  end

  if player_color == 'Green' then
    ash_deal.destruct()
    ash_hit.destruct()
    ash_stand.destruct()
  end

  if player_color == 'Orange' then
    bella_deal.destruct()
    bella_hit.destruct()
    bella_stand.destruct()
  end
end

function onUpdate()
    --[[ print('onUpdate loop!') --]]
end
